subhead: At 80, Oracle's founder – one of the world's wealthiest executives and an eccentric figurehead of the 2000s – has returned to the spotlight thanks to Donald Trump. title: Texas in shock after fatal flood kills over 50 people with dozens missing
subhead: Fifteen children are among the dead after the flooding of the Guadalupe River struck a popular tourist region. Dozens more girls attending a summer camp are reported missing.

subhead: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is due to meet on Monday with US President Donald Trump, who has been making a renewed push to end the fighting.

subhead: The iconic river reopened to the public for the first time in a century on Saturday, but was closed for swimming one day later after rainfall.

title: Iranian photographer Forough Alaei portrays life during the war: 'Nothing will ever be the same again'
subhead: After the first Israeli bombings in Iran, Iranian photographer Forough Alaei left Tehran to take refuge with her family on the Caspian Sea coast. She documented those days when war plunged them into the unknown.

title: In the jaws of the Jackal: How an informant orchestrated a policewoman's fall
subhead: Sonia C. was still a law enforcement officer when, in April 2024, she was sentenced to three years in prison for handing police files to an informant known as the Jackal. Naivety still marks this former officer, who loved to party until dawn and used cocaine.

title: 'Anger has become, from Trump to Le Pen, a powerful weapon for the far right'
subhead: Emotions like anger can numb critical thinking, make people forget facts, and even lead them to vote against their own interests, writes Le Monde's Philippe Bernard in his column.

title: Corsican mafia undergoing 'major recomposition,' intelligence report says
subhead: According to French crime investigators, new power balances are emerging between two blocs on the Mediterranean island: the Petit Bar gang and the Mattei clan, which is uniting groups from various regions.
